title: Easy Apple Slaw Recipe
description: This apple slaw with cabbage, apples, carrots, and peppers in a light homemade dressing makes a fresh, crunchy side perfect for summer BBQs.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Coleslaw Recipes Apple Coleslaw Recipes Easy Apple Slaw 4.7 (774) 582 Reviews 45 Photos This apple slaw is one of our favorite summer recipes. It's a yummy combo of fruit and veggies in a sweet dressing — a must at every barbecue or potluck! Submitted by Aunt Mamie Updated on June 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 45 45 45 45 Prep Time: 25 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 cups chopped cabbage 1 unpeeled red apple, cored and chopped 1 unpeeled Granny Smith apple, cored and chopped 1 carrot, grated ½ cup finely chopped red bell pepper 2 green onions, finely chopped ⅓ cup mayonnaise ⅓ cup brown sugar 1 tablespoon lemon juice, or to taste Directions Combine cabbage, red apple, green apple, carrot, red bell pepper, and green onions in a large bowl. To make the dressing: Mix mayonnaise, brown sugar, and lemon juice together in a small bowl. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture; mix until evenly coated. Edible Times I Made It Print 1,064 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 137 Calories 5g Fat 25g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 137 % Daily Value * Total Fat 5g 6% Saturated Fat 1g 4% Cholesterol 3mg 1% Sodium 108mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 25g 9% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 20g Protein 1g 2% Vitamin C 33mg 37% Calcium 38mg 3% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 206mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Apple Slaw 01 of 45 Photo by  Edible Times 02 of 45 Photo by  Edible Times 06/02/2024 It has way too much sugar, but otherwise, it is a perfectly fine coleslaw. Skip all the chopping and just buy a bag of coleslaw mix and shredded carrots. 03 of 45 Photo by  Nancy G 07/04/2021 04 of 45 Photo by  Riding with Larry 08/25/2020 Excellent Recipe....and it is easy to make. I had a Delicious & a Jonathon apple, so I used both of them instead of the granny smith. I only have green peppers from my garden to go with my garden cabbage so used those instead of the red peppers. I also used a whole onion instead of the green onions. Nudged the mayo, & lemon juice until it was perfect. Added a pinch of salt & pepper and a dash of garlic for medicinal purposes.....I will make this again...it is droolicious.... 05 of 45 Photo by  Cassandra LaCour 06/21/2020 06 of 45 Photo by  tjrox 05/28/2020 This fruity coleslaw turned out GREAT! I didn't change anything except measurements because I made a lot of it. Go easy on the dressing and add more as you need it because the flavor stays throughout and then you won't have it sitting in the extra dressing. This is definitely going into my Favorite Recipe book. 07 of 45 Photo by  Chris 05/12/2020 08 of 45 Photo by  Stephanie 04/27/2020 This slaw is so refreshing and easy to make. My family was very hesitant to eat apples in a slaw but they really enjoyed this fresh dish. The only thing I will do differently is I plan to cut the apples into smaller pieces because I felt like they were a tad too big. 09 of 45 Photo by  Chef Mo 03/12/2020 I love a sweet coleslaw and at first I was worried about the brown sugar. Have no fear, this is a great recipe! I love the flavor of the apples with the cabbage. Don't skip this one for your picnic! 10 of 45 Photo by  Donna Moore Whiting 12/13/2018 Instead of brown sugar I used organic coconut palm sugar. my mother is a diabetic and this was a great alternative to her usual coleslaw. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Cranberry Coleslaw 20 Ratings Caribbean Slaw 21 Ratings Pineapple Slaw 21 Ratings Bayou's Mardi Gras Slaw 17 Ratings Taco Slaw 77 Ratings Fresh Fruit with Poppy Seed Dressing 35 Ratings Summer Corn Salad with Asparagus 37 Ratings Red BBQ Slaw 57 Ratings Apple Coleslaw 94 Ratings Pico de Gallo with Cabbage (Mexican Coleslaw) 14 Ratings Curtido (El Salvadoran Cabbage Salad) 35 Ratings Grilled Corn Salad 151 Ratings Tangy Mango Slaw 25 Ratings Szybka Surowka z Czerwonej Kapusty (Polish Red Cabbage Slaw) 1 Rating Kohlrabi and Apple Slaw 23 Ratings Lower-Fat Coleslaw 29 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Aunt Mamie
instructions: Combine cabbage, red apple, green apple, carrot, red bell pepper, and green onions in a large bowl.;To make the dressing: Mix mayonnaise, brown sugar, and lemon juice together in a small bowl. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture; mix until evenly coated. Edible Times
